entry.title: 1. Peters Pub - 6pm
entry.hours: A good place to start the 12 pub adventure, although Aisling Hannon & Co you need to move to the next Pub at 6.30pm!

locations.entry: 2. Capitol Bar - 6.30pm 53.341251 -6.265297, All cocktails 2 for 1, specially for the iQ 12 Pubs.

entry.title: 3. Hogans - 7pm
entry.hours: "I really like Hogans because, and this may take some explaining, it's really easy to use. What I mean by that is that this pub operates completely without hassle. The furniture is of the really simple, no frills, "place ass here" school and I think that has an effect on everyones mood. It's a good old school style that encourages conversation, a very positive feature in any pub." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 4. Market Bar - 7.30pm
entry.hours: "It's awfully loud in the market bar. It used to be an abattoir but it's a gorgeous building despite this fact." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 5. Grogans - 8pm
entry.hours: This one is specially for the iQ Alumni of Derek & Conor

entry.title: 6. Dakota - 8.30pm
entry.hours: "The staff are relatively good, and they generally have enough staff on that you're not waiting long for a drink. Their doormen have always been very polite to me as well which is a plus (not that I look rough or owt, but sometimes theyre just bad-tempered" - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 7. O'Neills - 9pm
entry.hours: "What are the unique qualities that make this particular establishment so appealing, you ask? Well, it's bar has a brass rail (VERY important, if you have ask why, well there's no use explaining it to you). There's trad music every night, they do a lovely carvery at a reasonable price and, probably most importantly for me personally, they sell Beamish. Added to this, the pub was built when pubs were laid out like proper pubs: lots of walls and little snug corners to hide away in." Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 8. The Bank - 9.30pm
entry.hours: This one is on the list specially for Rosarie, yes you are in the right location!

entry.title: 9. Foggy Dew - 10pm
entry.hours: "The Foggy Dew hosts a glut of middle aged scene rockers and punks who still barfly their old dingy pub even though it has been renovated into a modern memorabilia filled rock bar. They swing about each other in small concentric circles and it has been said that the place can be slightly off putting to new comers not familiar with the often stand off-ish cliques." Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 10. The Mercantile - 10.30pm
entry.hours: "They pour a nice pint of Smithwick's" - Courtesy of Yelp. Fabrizio will be happy.

entry.title: 11. Stag's Head - 11pm
entry.hours: "Proper pub tucked away behind Dame Street. The Stag's Head doesn't do anything modern or wacky, but just has that special atmosphere of conviviality and warmth that a pub should have. Great pints in a snug friendly space with friends you didn't know before you stepped in the door." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 12. The Globe - 11.30pm
entry.hours: "The Globe is one of those pubs that's good but nobodies favorite. It can be jammers or vacant, amazing or disastrous and company varies just as much as anywhere else." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie
